channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sánchez Bezos commit $102.5 million to organizations combatting homelessness across the U.S.: ‘This is just the beginning’
item.description: “It’s a $2 billion commitment,” Sánchez Bezos said. “And we’re going to continue doing it."

item.title: Large Winter Storm Brings Snow and Ice to Northeast and Mid-Atlantic
item.description: The major storm dropped a wintry mix of precipitation across the Midwest overnight, creating a treacherous commute for millions of Americans.

item.title: Nearly half of U.S. truck-driving schools face closure in crackdown on ‘poorly trained drivers’
item.description: The questionable schools were really just “fleecing people out of money” without teaching them the skills they need to get hired or pass the test, tru...

item.title: Meet Amar Subramanya, the 46-year-old Google and Microsoft veteran who will now steer Apple’s supremely important AI strategy
item.description: “We are pleased to welcome Amar to Craig’s leadership team and to bring his extraordinary AI expertise to Apple," CEO Tim Cook said in a statement.

item.title: The trade war was never going to fix our deficit
item.description: Trump's tariffs won't alter the trajectory of our national debt or entitlements. For the economy's sake, the Supreme Court should end this abuse of po...

item.title: Inside the economics of Candace Owens’ media empire and the Macron lawsuit threatening to unravel it
item.description: The French president and first lady have tapped the firm behind Dominion’s $787.5 million win against Fox News to pursue Owens personally and commerci...

item.title: San Francisco Will Sue Ultraprocessed Food Companies
item.description: The city attorney accuses large manufacturers of causing diseases that have burdened governments with public health costs.

item.title: Thousands Greet Pope Leo as He Prays Near Site of Beirut Port Blast
item.description: A waterfront Mass in the Lebanese capital capped the pope’s three-day visit to the Middle Eastern nation with the largest proportion of Christians.

item.title: Tennessee House Special Election 2025: What to Watch

item.title: Vaccine Committee May Make Significant Changes to Childhood Schedule
item.description: Comments by President Trump, Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and some panelists suggest the committee is likely to delay hepatitis B shots and ...

item.title: Pope Leo XIV Delivers Message of Peace in Lebanon
item.description: The pope ended his first international tour presiding over a waterfront mass to thousands at the site of a 2020 Beirut port explosion, which killed hu...

item.title: The Philippines Spent Big on Flood Control, but the Water Keeps Rising
item.description: Many Filipinos say floods are worse than ever — and now, the government has admitted that vast sums were embezzled from a program meant to fight the p...

item.title: Sharks and Rays Gain Sweeping Protections from Wildlife Trade
item.description: A global treaty has extended trade protections to more than 70 shark and ray species whose numbers are in sharp decline.

item.title: Thousands Greet Pope Leo as He Prays Near Site of Beirut Port Blast
item.description: A waterfront Mass in the Lebanese capital capped the pope’s three-day visit to the Middle Eastern nation with the largest proportion of Christians.
